tasks.title: Coordinate manual logging setup
tasks.description: Coordinate with Derek to set up a simple logging sheet or app for the next couple of weeks to ensure data continuity due to sensor issues.
tasks.evidence: Priya: Yeah, we’ve talked about that. I’ll coordinate with Derek to set up a simple logging sheet or app for the next couple of weeks.

tasks.title: Lead organization of manual logs
tasks.description: Take the lead on organizing manual logs and check with the team to make sure everyone is on board with the manual logging process.
tasks.evidence: Derek: I’ll take the lead on organizing the manual logs. Should be straightforward. I’ll check with the team to make sure everyone’s on board.

tasks.title: Update report with robot improvement metrics
tasks.description: Update the notes and stats in the report to carefully document the noticeable improvement in the robot's path planning and fewer collisions overall.
tasks.evidence: Sam: That’s encouraging. Let’s be sure to document that carefully, especially the improvement metrics. Priya, can you ensure those go into the report? Priya: Absolutely, I’ll update the notes and stats this afternoon.

tasks.title: Apply filters to clean noisy battery data
tasks.description: Apply filters to clean the noisy battery log data to make it easier to pinpoint the cause of unexpected robot shutdowns (hardware or firmware).
tasks.evidence: Derek: I’m planning to apply some filters to clean the data and will collaborate with Priya to dig deeper.

tasks.title: Collaborate on battery issue investigation
tasks.description: Sync up and collaborate with Priya to dig deeper into the unexpected robot battery shutdowns after applying filters to clean the data, and keep Sam posted on progress.
tasks.evidence: Derek: I’m planning to apply some filters to clean the data and will collaborate with Priya to dig deeper. Sam: Great teamwork. Derek and Priya, sync up on that and keep me posted.

tasks.title: Update experiment wiki with sensor issues
tasks.description: Update the experiment wiki pages with notes on sensor glitches and missing data to ensure the whole team is aware of these issues.
tasks.evidence: Sam: Also, please update the experiment wiki pages with notes on sensor glitches and missing data, so the whole team is aware. Priya: I’ll take that on and aim to finish today.

tasks.title: Update wiki's data analysis section
tasks.description: Update the data analysis section of the experiment wiki pages.
tasks.evidence: Derek: I’ll handle updating the data analysis section.

tasks.title: Circulate paper draft for internal review
tasks.description: Circulate the first draft of the paper, including methods and results sections, for internal review.
tasks.evidence: Nina: The first draft of methods and results is mostly done. We’re aiming to circulate it by Friday for internal review.

tasks.title: Send calendar invites for paper review session
tasks.description: Send calendar invites for the paper review session scheduled for Monday afternoon.
tasks.evidence: Nina: Yeah, Monday afternoon. I’ll send calendar invites.

tasks.title: Add section on experimental limitations to paper
tasks.description: Add a section to the paper detailing experimental limitations, including transparency on sensor and battery issues, to be upfront with reviewers and readers.
tasks.evidence: Priya: Should we add a section about experimental limitations in the paper? Like transparency on sensor and battery issues. Sam: Definitely. It’s important to be upfront about that.

analysis_results.meeting_summary: The team addressed persistent timing sensor and robot battery issues, deciding to implement manual logging as a temporary solution and to thoroughly investigate battery data. They agreed to focus the upcoming conference demo on obstacle avoidance, utilizing a mix of recorded and simple live demonstrations. Additionally, the first draft of the research paper is due Friday for internal review, and it was decided to include a section on experimental limitations.
decisions: Manual logging will be used as a backup to maintain data continuity due to timing sensor issues.
The conference demo in December will focus on obstacle avoidance and path optimization, which have stable data.
The conference demo will consist of a recorded demo of the full run, supplemented with live Q&A, and a short, simple live robot demonstration.
A section about experimental limitations, covering sensor and battery issues, will be added to the research paper.
